trans-unit.source: Creating, dropping, and backing up databases

seg-source.mrk: Creating, dropping, and backing up databases

target.mrk: Creating, dropping, and backing up databases

trans-unit.source: You create new databases and access existing ones by specifying attributes to the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> connection URL.

seg-source.mrk: You create new databases and access existing ones by specifying attributes to the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> connection URL.

target.mrk: You create new databases and access existing ones by specifying attributes to the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> connection URL.

trans-unit.source: If you use an in-memory database, you can use a connection URL attribute to drop it. For a file system database, however, there is no drop attribute. To drop a database on the file system, delete the database directory with operating system commands. The database must not be booted when you remove a database. You can get a list of booted databases with getPropertyInfo.

seg-source.mrk: If you use an in-memory database, you can use a connection URL attribute to drop it.
For a file system database, however, there is no drop attribute.
To drop a database on the file system, delete the database directory with operating system commands.
The database must not be booted when you remove a database.
You can get a list of booted databases with getPropertyInfo.

target.mrk: If you use an in-memory database, you can use a connection URL attribute to drop it.
For a file system database, however, there is no drop attribute.
To drop a database on the file system, delete the database directory with operating system commands.
The database must not be booted when you remove a database.
You can get a list of booted databases with getPropertyInfo.

trans-unit.source: To back up a database, you can use the online backup utility. For information on this utility, see the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citadmin"></ph></cite>.

seg-source.mrk: To back up a database, you can use the online backup utility.
For information on this utility, see the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citadmin"></ph></cite>.

target.mrk: To back up a database, you can use the online backup utility.
For information on this utility, see the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citadmin"></ph></cite>.

trans-unit.source: You can also use roll-forward recovery to recover a damaged database. accomplishes roll-forward recovery by using a full backup copy of the database, archived logs, and active logs from the most recent time before a failure. For more information on roll-forward recovery see the .

seg-source.mrk: You can also use roll-forward recovery to recover a damaged database.

<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> accomplishes roll-forward recovery by using a full backup copy of the database, archived logs, and active logs from the most recent time before a failure.
For more information on roll-forward recovery see the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citadmin"></ph></cite>.

target.mrk: You can also use roll-forward recovery to recover a damaged database.

<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> accomplishes roll-forward recovery by using a full backup copy of the database, archived logs, and active logs from the most recent time before a failure.
For more information on roll-forward recovery see the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citadmin"></ph></cite>.
